attributes.action: review property stamp duty levels and created a system that does not have full value tiers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently stamp duty goes up for the whole cost of the property so the cost of stamp duty if you pay £249,000 is £2,490. If you pay £250,001 (£2 more pounds!) your stamp duty bill goes up to £7500.03 more than £5000 for paying £2 more.

Rates of stamp duty should be altered so that each level applies to the proportion of the property price in which it falls, so if you paid £250,001 the cost would be 1% on the first £250,000 and 3% on the £1 over the threshold. This may require a review of the threshold levels and percentages chardged but would help buyers who are put off houses priced between £250,000 and £300,000 becuase of the unreasonable amount of duty paid.
